channel.title: 8x4 ft dry-erase board for $15
channel.description:
I came across this today and went to Home Depot as soon as possible to pick it up. It's a huge sheet of I guess shower wall but it works as a dry erase board too! The equivalent whiteboard actual whiteboard is $264 on Amazon.
If you're curious, it doesn't feel the same as writing on a whiteboard (obviously, since it's not a whiteboard). It has a slightly bumpy texture and dry erase markers erase a bit differently. Rather than drying and turning into shavings when they're removed, the ink just comes off and leaves a slight smudge but nothing worth noticing or complaining about. You can clean the board with water. I recommend buying an eraser. I mounted mine with double-sided tape (4lbs of support worth) and 8 thumbtacks after cutting it in half.
http://www.homedepot.com/p/Unbranded-Thrifty-White-32-sq-ft-Hardboard-Panel-Board-709106/202090193?AID=11210757&PID=7105813&SID=skim33330X911647X8ade6391b8bf6b3c6e531b74bcf75465&cm_mmc=CJ-_-7105813-_-11210757&cj=true
[img]http://puu.sh/gCr7t/be98d7bca1.jpg[/img]

item.title: 8x4 ft dry-erase board for $15
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

[quote=“Jmood, post:16, topic:550599”]Little did you all know, Lin gets a kick back for doing this.[/quote]I wish…

[quote=“ox random xi, post:19, topic:550599”]I would love one but I have no idea where I’d put this thing

what kind of eraser were you using?[/quote]Covering your wall is a great idea. I can’t find it online, but I got a mouse-shaped eraser from Target that was very cheap. It’s a good idea to get an eraser that has a hard plastic shell so you can push very hard, unlike the terrible Styrofoam ones Expo makes, because as I’ve found out the hard way, ink that has been on the board for a long time takes a workout to erase completely without a cleaner.

Read full topic

item.title: 8x4 ft dry-erase board for $15
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

[quote=“Yz85Racer, post:4, topic:550599”]Actually no load up. This seems extremely useful. I usually buy whiteboards each semester and hang them up in my study. Might consider this (if it ships to Australia etc).

Any ideas how to make it hangable rather than having to be permanently fixed? I like to pull my whiteboards down, write up notes for the week, and put it back up[/quote]Plenty of options. I’d suggest gluing something that sticks out on the top two corners and putting nails in your wall, so you can rest the parts sticking out on the nails. Another option is to glue magnets to both the back of the board and your wall.

Read full topic
